Welcome to course: Operational Resilience: Frameworks for Global Disruptions by MTF Institute

MTF Institute is a global educational and research institute headquartered in Lisbon, Portugal. We offer hybrid business and professional education in the areas of Business and Management, Science and Technology, and Banking and Finance.

MTF Institute is an official partner of Deloitte, IBM, Intel, and Microsoft, and is a member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry and the Union of Trade and Services Associations of Lisbon.

MTF Institute has a global presence across 216 countries and territories and has been chosen by more than 980,000 students.


Course Author:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. With a Doctorate Degree from the School of Social Sciences and Politics in Lisbon, Portugal, where she was awarded distinction and honour for her exemplary research, Alex Amoroso brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table.

In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses to a wide range of students from undergraduate level to business professionals and executives. Currently, as Head of the School of Business and Management at MTF, she leads the Product Development academic domain. At EIMT, where she also supervises doctoral students, Ms. Amoroso offers advanced instruction in research design and methodologies. Furthermore, she serves as a Research Consultant.

In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. She implemented the best market practices in industries from Banking and Finance, to PropTech, Consulting and Research, and Innovative Startups.

Alex Amoroso's extensive scientific production includes numerous published articles in reputable journals, as well as oral presentations and posters at international conferences. Her research findings have been presented at esteemed institutions such as the School of Political and Social Sciences and the Stressed Out Conference at UCL, among others.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


Operational resilience has become a critical capability for modern organizations. Global disruptions—from supply chain breakdowns and geopolitical risk to economic volatility, climate events, and rapid technological change—are now part of everyday operations. Organizations that succeed are those that can anticipate disruption, manage risk, and adapt quickly.

Operational Resilience: Frameworks for Global Disruptions is a practical course for operations managers, supply chain professionals, risk managers, and business leaders who want to build resilient operations that can withstand shocks and recover fast.

The course goes beyond traditional business continuity planning and focuses on operational resilience frameworks that help organizations identify vulnerabilities, reduce operational risk, and strengthen critical processes. You will learn how to assess operational risk, map dependencies, identify single points of failure, and design agile, flexible operating models.

Key topics include risk assessment and impact analysis, crisis management and communication, supply chain resilience and diversification, scenario planning, and future-proofing operations. You will also explore how technology, data visibility, and digital tools can improve early warning, response, and recovery during disruptions.

A strong emphasis is placed on practical application. Through real-world case studies and hands-on exercises, you will apply resilience strategies to operations, supply chains, and organizational processes. The course concludes with an implementation toolkit, including risk heat maps, scenario planning templates, crisis response frameworks, and a step-by-step roadmap for embedding operational resilience across your organization.

By the end of the course, you will have the skills, frameworks, and confidence to design, implement, and lead resilient operations—capable of managing uncertainty, responding to global disruptions, and sustaining long-term performance.

courseDetails.title: IA Responsable y Ética
courseDetails.shortDescription: Domina gobernanza, sesgos, privacidad y seguridad para implementar GenAI con confianza
courseDetails.longDescription:
¿Te entusiasma usar IA en tu trabajo, pero te preocupa hacerlo “a la ligera” y terminar con problemas de sesgos, privacidad, alucinaciones o decisiones difíciles de explicar? Entonces este curso es para ti. Te presento “IA Ética y Responsable”, un curso práctico para implementar IA con confianza: crear valor real con límites claros, evidencia y buenas prácticas que tu equipo pueda aplicar desde el primer día.

En cinco módulos, pasas de la intención a la ejecución. Empezamos por lo esencial: qué hace (y qué no) la GenAI, cómo definir un propósito responsable y traducir principios como justicia, transparencia, seguridad, privacidad y rendición de cuentas en políticas accionables. Luego aterrizamos la gobernanza del ciclo de vida, con responsabilidades claras tipo RACI, manejo de proveedores y respuesta a incidentes.

También trabajamos lo más crítico en la práctica: ética de datos y privacidad (consentimiento, minimización, retención, trazabilidad), sesgo y equidad con pruebas y umbrales razonables, y seguridad frente a fallas típicas (inyección de prompts, jailbreaks, fugas). Además, aprenderás a evaluar con criterios de “go/no-go”, hacer red teaming y monitorear en operación para mejorar continuamente. Cerramos con casos sectoriales y transparencia/UX responsable: avisos al usuario, explicaciones útiles y comunicación clara.

Vas a salir con entregables listos: matriz riesgo–valor, checklist de datos, scorecard de evaluación, plan de incidentes, políticas de una página y una Guía de Uso Responsable para tu equipo. Si quieres resultados sin improvisación, inscríbete hoy. ¡Te espero en clase!
targetAudiences: Personas interesadas en comprender el uso ético y responsable de la IA en distintos sectores, sin requerir una base técnica profunda.
